metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1645 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple integer signedness errors in the opj_j2k_update_image_data function in j2k.c in OpenJPEG, as used in PDFium in Google Chrome before 49.0.2623.87, allow remote attackers to cause a denial of service (incorrect cast and out-of-bounds write) or possibly have unspecified other impact via crafted JPEG 2000 data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-browser-l10n - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-chromedriver - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2623.87-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1112').
